newsitem.title: USA: Sprint awards $600 million contract to Samsung.
newsitem.headline: Sprint awards $600 million contract to Samsung.

text.p: Sprint Corp. said Thursday it awarded a three-year contract worth more than $600 million to South Korea's Samsung Electronics Co. for the manufacture of wireless telecommunications handsets.

The contract involves so-called code division multiple access or CDMA handsets to be used as part of the personal communications service network that Sprint is building in the United States. Sprint said initial deliveries were scheduled for next April.
"We believe this contract will serve as a springboard for Samsung's future marketing efforts of CDMA products in the U.S. and around the world," Samsung Executive Vice President Y.R. Song said.
